passages.text: China (PRC) | Internet Trip.com
Strong Execution Counts Review Up PT to Reflect Secular Story Ahead

TCOM reported 2Q results with revenue \(1.3\%\) and \(1.9\%\) ahead of consensus and our estimates respectively. Non- GAAP operating profit beat expectations. Management highlighted solid volume growth for domestic, outbound and pure international amid market share gain. Excellent service is key for travel vs subsidies. Inbound travel is in early stage. Al is applied to provide better experience for travelers. New share repurchase program has been announced. Maintain Buy.

2Q25 results highlights. Total revenue grew \(16\%\) YoY to RMB14.8bn, \(1.3\%\) and \(1.9\%\) ahead of consensus and our estimates, respectively. Accommodation revenue \((42\%)\) of total) increased \(21\%\) YoY (vs our estimate of \(16\%\) YoY) to RMB6.2bn. Transportation revenue \((36\%)\) of total) grew \(11\%\) YoY (vs our estimate at \(9\%\) YoY) to RMB5.4bn. Packaged tour revenue \((7\%)\) of total) increased \(5\%\) YoY (vs our estimate at \(17\%\) YoY) to RMB1.1bn. Corporate travel revenue \((5\%)\) of total) increased \(9\%\) YoY (vs our estimate \(11\%\) YoY) to RMB692m. Other revenue increased by about \(31\%\) YoY (vs our estimate at \(24\%\) YoY) to RMB1.5bn. Gross profit grew \(15\%\) YoY (vs our estimate of \(13\%\) YoY) to RMB12bn. Non- GAAP op profit (ex- share based compensation expenses) was RMB4.67bn, vs our estimate of RMB4.25bn. Non- GAAP op margin (ex- share based compensation expenses) reached \(31.4\%\) (vs our estimate at \(29.2\%\) ). Non- GAAP net profit reached RMB5bn, ahead of consensus and our estimates of RMB4.35bn and RMB3.7bn, respectively.

3Q outlook. In 3Q, we estimate total revenue to grow \(14\%\) YoY (vs our prior estimate at \(13.5\%\) YoY) to about RMB18.1bn. By segment, we expect accommodation revenue to grow \(16.5\%\) YoY to RMB7.9bn, wherein we expect domestic revenue to grow at \(10\%\) YoY mainly driven by volume. Transportation revenue is expected to grow at about \(10\%\) YoY to RMB6.2bn, wherein domestic air revenue is expected to grow at low single- digit YoY with volume growth offset by decline in revenue per ticket. Packaged tour revenue is expected to increase by about \(5\%\) YoY to RMB1.6bn and corporate travel to increase by about \(9\%\) YoY to about RMB715m. We expect GPM at about \(81\%\) and non- GAAP operating profit at about RMB5.85bn (vs our prior estimates at RMB5.18bn), and non- GAAP op margin at about \(32\%\) .

Key takeaways from conference call. These include (1) Al. TCOM highlighted there is a powerful impact integrating content with Al as users can get better personalized recommendations satisfying their needs. For Al agent Trip Planner, travelers can express their preferences and get good results sourced from millions of data points; (2) Recent travel demand and segments, domestic volume is strong, which is partially offset by decline in hotel ADR. Outbound, TCOM recovers to more than \(120\%\) of pre- covid level amid national fight recovers to about \(80 - 90\%\) . For pure international, bookings increased by more than \(60\%\) YoY outside China, wherein inbound travel to China increased by about \(100\%\) YoY (vs \(30\%\) YoY for industry).
Continued overleaf...
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-US analysts on pages 5 - 10 of this report. \\* Jefferies Hong Kong Limited

We believe Trip.com will continue to demonstrate strong execution, noting its proven track record as a leading online travel agency in China. Trip.com is a long- term story, benefiting from rising income levels and urbanization, as well as market share gains, not only in China but also overseas, with Skyscanner and Trip.com, in addition to investments in MakeMyTrip in India. With a highly- engaged user base and comprehensive product offering, Trip.com's first- rate travel app creates a virtuous circle and acts as a one- stop shop for travelers.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View

Trip.com continues to gain market share, outpacing travel market and economic growth rates on rising income levels and increased urbanization. We expect earnings growth on the back of rising revenue contribution from outbound travel, as well as margin expansion on high productivity and ROI in customer acquisition. PT of US \(85 / HK\) 659 based on DCF valuation.

Strong demand for business and leisure travel post macro recovery. Stronger- than- expected penetration in lower- tier city users. Faster- than- expected international expansion. PT of US \(96 / HK\) 745 based on DCF valuation.

Demand for business and leisure travel is severely impacted by macro headwinds. Aggressive marketing spending in lower- tier cities due to intense competition. Pace of international expansion is below market expectations. PT of US \(48 / HK\) 373 based on DCF valuation.

Top Material Issue(s): 1) Customer Privacy / Data Security: OTA companies have access to personal information of consumers, including personal information, purchase history and financial information etc. It is important to comply with all the regulations regarding personal information protection and strengthen security and compliance in data use. 2) Product Quality Management: OTA companies should put consumers' experience at the first place, and to offer more high- quality products and services to ensure consumers have pleasant travel experience.

Company Target(s): 1) TCOM will launch at least 10K low- carbon travel products with ecological partners, and promote low- carbon travel knowledge, driving 100mn people to participate in low- carbon travel practices.

Qs to Maint: 1) What are you investing to ensure data security and protect customer information? 2) What measure do you take to provide more high- quality products and services and ensure the experience of consumers?

Stronger- than- expected margin expansion from leverage of sales and marketing expenses with Trip.com emphasizing ROI on customer acquisition across different channels. Stronger- than- expected user growth from lower- tier cities. Faster- than- expected pace of international expansion.

In terms of travel sentiment, travelers want to try out a perimeal products such as concerts and other music products; (3) Volume and Prtive these include (a) Volume growth is seen for domestic, inbound and to outbound travel; (b) dohistic market: Hotel and air ticket price is under pressure despite good demand. There is a single digit YoY increase on supply side. Domestic hotel ADR is seeing stabilization with ADR decline by low to mid single digit YoY during summer; (c) outbound travel: air ticket price continues to be softening YoY due to increasing flight capacity recovery but still higher than pre- covid level. Hotel price remains stable; (4) Competition. TCOM considers excellent service is key vs subsidies. It provides good products and service to win the hearts of travelers; (5) Sliver and young generation. These include (a) silver generation: people who are 50- 55 year old are energetic and have money to travel around the world. It is a big market at over RMB1tn over the next 3- 5 years. They are not price sensitive customers; (b) young generation: it is a robust business with demand exceeds supply. They are willing to try new products; (6) Trip.com. These include (a) bookings increased by over 60% YoY with APAC as a key region contributing most of the revenue; (b) triple digit growth is seen in inbound segment; (c) strong synergies is seen due to the overlap between APAC and inbound travelers; (d) loyalty program also drives user retention and upgrade of service offerings; (e) global market is a big one which can accommodate different players. TCOM provides one- stop travel offerings, good inventory and price. It pursues mobile first strategy, good customer experience and localizes marketing spending; (7) International expansion on S&M. TCOM pursues ROI focused approach in marketing. Native mobile app accounts for 70% of global orders. It allocates resources on highly efficient channels backed by user insights; (8) Inbound travel. TCOM considers China as a good destination for inbound due to its long history. Inbound travel as % of GDP is about 0.3% during pre- covid vs 5% of GDP for other regions; (9) Buyback program. These include (a) the new buyback of USD5bn is funded by its own cash and proceed from recent deals; (b) It is a multi- year program without expiration date. Shares can be repurchased in US and HK markets. TCOM is committed to providing long- term shareholder value to investors

Valuation and risks. We maintain our Buy rating and revise up our DCF- based PT to USD85/ HKD659 (prior USD80/HKD621) factoring in better long term assumptions post results. Key risks include: (1) prolonged macro headwinds leading to weaker- than- expected outlook; (2) higher- than- expected marketing spend on hotel segment in lower- tier cities; and (3) intense competition overseas with global players.
Exhibit 1 -TCOM US: Income Statement
Source: Company, Jefferies estimates
Exhibit 2 -TCOM US: Balance Sheet
Source: Company, Jefferies estimates
Exhibit 3 -TCOM US: Cash Flow Statement
Source: Company, Jefferies estimates

We would like to thank Fiona Fan, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report. We would like to thank Han Wang, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report We would like to thank Erica Qiu, employee of Evaluerserve Inc., for providing research support services to our preparation of this report.

Trip.com Group Ltd. provides online travel agency services. The company offers mobile applications, hotel reservations, flight ticketing, package tours, corporate travel management, and train ticketing services.

We have a Buy rating and DCF- based PT of USD85/HKD659. Key risks include (1) prolonged macro headwinds lead to weaker- than- expected outlook; (2) higher- than- expected marketing spend on hotel segment in lower- tier cities; and (3) intense competition overseas with global players.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR)
Recommendation Published August 28, 2025 1:06 A.M. Recommendation Distributed August 28, 2025 1:06 A.M.

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
